byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg reported from New York; Jennifer Medina from Oakland, Calif.; and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo. Liz Robbins and Sandra E. Garcia contributed reporting from New York, and Noah Gilbert from Los Angeles.
byline.original: By ELI ROSENBERG, JENNIFER MEDINA and JOHN ELIGON

abstract: Large-scale, ad hoc protests over Donald J Trump's presidential victory spring up in cities around country with only isolated incidents of violence; demonstrations are likened to widespread unrest that followed election of Abraham Lincoln in 1860.
lead_paragraph: Beyond the commotion in the streets, liberal activists are preparing legislative challenges and getting ready to support social services they assume will be gutted.
snippet: Beyond the commotion in the streets, liberal activists are preparing legislative challenges and getting ready to support social services they assume will be gutted....

headline.main: Protesters Take Anti-Trump Message to His Doorstep, and Plan Next Steps
headline.print_headline: Protesters Take Anti-Trump Message to His Doorstep, and Plan Next Move
